etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From sub- + chela

definitions: In certain crustaceans: a small pincer-like structure on the end of a limb, in which the last segment is folded back against the previous one.

notes.text: The penultimate segment (propodus) is less fully developed than it is in a chela.
